docs.lead_paragraph: Some insurance plans offered on the health overhaul law's new marketplaces violate the law's requirements for women's health, according to a new report from a women's legal advocacy group.

headline.main: Report: Insurers Skirt Health Law's Protections for Women
headline.print_headline: Report: Insurers Skirt Health Law's Protections for Women

docs.snippet: Some insurance plans offered on the health overhaul law's new marketplaces violate the law's requirements for women's health, according to a new report from a women's legal advocacy group.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem's first-quarter earnings jumped 23 percent thanks in part to a spike in Medicaid enrollment, and it became the latest health insurer to raise its forecast for the year after breezing past Wall Street's expectations.

headline.main: Anthem Joins Insurer Crowd in Beating Street 1Q Expectations
headline.print_headline: Anthem Joins Insurer Crowd in Beating Street 1Q Expectations

docs.snippet: Anthem's first-quarter earnings jumped 23 percent thanks in part to a spike in Medicaid enrollment, and it became the latest health insurer to raise its forecast for the year after breezing past Wall Street's expectations.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem Inc, the second-largest U.S. health insurer, reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit, helped by rise in memberships for government plans, particularly Medicaid.

headline.main: Health Insurer Anthem's Profit Beats as Medicaid Enrollments Rise
headline.print_headline: Health Insurer Anthem's Profit Beats as Medicaid Enrollments Rise

docs.snippet: Anthem Inc, the second-largest U.S. health insurer, reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit, helped by rise in memberships for government plans, particularly Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: In his nascent presidential campaign, the Wisconsin governor wants to position himself as a deeply conservative alternative to Jeb Bush and Marco Rubio.
docs.snippet: In his nascent presidential campaign, the Wisconsin governor wants to position himself as a deeply conservative alternative to Jeb Bush and Marco Rubio.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Argentina canceled its foreign debt, the result was ugly.

headline.main: What Greece Faces if It Defaults
headline.print_headline: What Greece Would Face in a Default

docs.abstract: Uki Goni Op-Ed article disputes arguments put forth by those who are using experience of Argentina in 2001 to urge Greece to default on its debt now; describes how Argentina's decision to default led to years of hardship, particularly for lower middle class.
docs.snippet: When Argentina canceled its foreign debt, the result was ugly.

docs.lead_paragraph: The folk duo Brown Bird’s final release, “Axis Mundi,” was recorded just before — and finished just after — the singer-songwriter David Lamb’s death from leukemia.

headline.main: In the Midst of Tragedy, Creating an Album as a Form of Therapy

docs.snippet: The folk duo Brown Bird’s final release, “Axis Mundi,” was recorded just before — and finished just after — the singer-songwriter David Lamb’s death from leukemia.

docs.lead_paragraph: When the economic underpinning of full employment at a decent wage gave in, America’s safety net proved too weak to hold society together.

headline.main: Income Inequality Is Costing the U.S. on Social Issues
headline.print_headline: Income Inequality Is Costing the Nation on Social Issues

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column examines data revealing United States' startling decline among high-income nations in terms of infant mortality, life expectancy and other measures of social welfare; argues that key factors are widening income inequality and erosion of social safety net; contends trends may result in such a dysfunctional future that voters will eventually demand improvement to broken political system.
docs.snippet: When the economic underpinning of full employment at a decent wage gave in, America’s safety net proved too weak to hold society together.
